intro: Astragalus eusarathron, commonly known as the narrow-leaved milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia, including parts of Kazakhstan and Mongolia. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets. Its flowers are usually yellow or pale yellow, arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, woody pods that contain several seeds. Astragalus eusarathron is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
